17// The nci flag is currently used to experiment with feedback collection in
18// optimized code produced by generic lowering.
19// Considerations:
20// - Should we increment the call count? https://crbug.com/v8/10524
21// - Is feedback already megamorphic in all these cases?
22//
23// TODO(jgruber): Remove once we've made a decision whether to collect feedback
24// unconditionally.
25inline bool CollectFeedbackInGenericLowering() {
26 return v8_flags.turbo_collect_feedback_in_generic_lowering;
27}
28
29enum class StackCheckKind : uint8_t {
30 kJSFunctionEntry = 0,
31 kJSIterationBody,
32 kCodeStubAssembler,
33 kWasm,
34};
35
36inline Runtime::FunctionId GetBuiltinForStackCheckKind(StackCheckKind kind) {
37 if (kind == StackCheckKind::kJSFunctionEntry) {
38 return Runtime::kStackGuardWithGap;
39 } else if (kind == StackCheckKind::kJSIterationBody) {
40 return Runtime::kHandleNoHeapWritesInterrupts;
41 } else {
42 return Runtime::kStackGuard;
43 }
44}
45
46enum class CanThrow : uint8_t { kNo, kYes };
47
48inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, StackCheckKind kind) {
49 switch (kind) {
50 case StackCheckKind::kJSFunctionEntry:
51 return os << "JSFunctionEntry";
52 case StackCheckKind::kJSIterationBody:
53 return os << "JSIterationBody";
54 case StackCheckKind::kCodeStubAssembler:
55 return os << "CodeStubAssembler";
56 case StackCheckKind::kWasm:
57 return os << "Wasm";
58 }
59 UNREACHABLE();
60}
61
62inline size_t hash_value(StackCheckKind kind) {
63 return static_cast<size_t>(kind);
64}
65
66enum class CheckForMinusZeroMode : uint8_t {
67 kCheckForMinusZero,
68 kDontCheckForMinusZero,
69};
70
71inline size_t hash_value(CheckForMinusZeroMode mode) {
72 return static_cast<size_t>(mode);
73}
74
75inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, CheckForMinusZeroMode mode) {
76 switch (mode) {
77 case CheckForMinusZeroMode::kCheckForMinusZero:
78 return os << "check-for-minus-zero";
79 case CheckForMinusZeroMode::kDontCheckForMinusZero:
80 return os << "dont-check-for-minus-zero";
81 }
82 UNREACHABLE();
83}
84
85// The CallFeedbackRelation provides the meaning of the call feedback for a
86// TurboFan JSCall operator
87// - kReceiver: The call target was Function.prototype.apply and its receiver
88// was recorded as the feedback value.
89// - kTarget: The call target was recorded as the feedback value.
90// - kUnrelated: The feedback is no longer related to the call. If, during
91// lowering, a JSCall (e.g. of a higher order function) is replaced by a
92// JSCall with another target, the feedback has to be kept but is now
93// unrelated.
94enum class CallFeedbackRelation { kReceiver, kTarget, kUnrelated };
95
96inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os,
97 CallFeedbackRelation call_feedback_relation) {
98 switch (call_feedback_relation) {
99 case CallFeedbackRelation::kReceiver:
100 return os << "CallFeedbackRelation::kReceiver";
101 case CallFeedbackRelation::kTarget:
102 return os << "CallFeedbackRelation::kTarget";
103 case CallFeedbackRelation::kUnrelated:
104 return os << "CallFeedbackRelation::kUnrelated";
105 }
106 UNREACHABLE();
107}
108
109// Maximum depth and total number of elements and properties for literal
110// graphs to be considered for fast deep-copying. The limit is chosen to
111// match the maximum number of inobject properties, to ensure that the
112// performance of using object literals is not worse than using constructor
113// functions, see crbug.com/v8/6211 for details.
114const int kMaxFastLiteralDepth = 3;
115const int kMaxFastLiteralProperties = JSObject::kMaxInObjectProperties;
116
117enum BaseTaggedness : uint8_t { kUntaggedBase, kTaggedBase };
118
119enum class MemoryAccessKind : uint8_t {
120 kNormal,
121 kUnaligned,
122 kProtected,
123};
124
125size_t hash_value(MemoryAccessKind);
126
127V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream&, MemoryAccessKind);
128
129inline ExternalArrayType GetArrayTypeFromElementsKind(ElementsKind kind) {
130 switch (kind) {
131#define TYPED_ARRAY_CASE(Type, type, TYPE, ctype) \
132 case TYPE##_ELEMENTS: \
133 case RAB_GSAB_##TYPE##_ELEMENTS: \
134 return kExternal##Type##Array;
135 TYPED_ARRAYS(TYPED_ARRAY_CASE)
136#undef TYPED_ARRAY_CASE
137 default:
138 break;
139 }
140 UNREACHABLE();
141}
142
143inline int ExternalArrayElementSize(const ExternalArrayType element_type) {
144 switch (element_type) {
145#define TYPED_ARRAY_CASE(Type, type, TYPE, ctype) \
146 case kExternal##Type##Array: \
147 DCHECK_LE(sizeof(ctype), 8); \
148 return sizeof(ctype);
149 TYPED_ARRAYS(TYPED_ARRAY_CASE)
150 default:
151 UNREACHABLE();
152#undef TYPED_ARRAY_CASE
153 }
154}

160// The biggest double value that fits within the int64_t/uint64_t value range.
161// This is different from safe integer range in that there are gaps of integers
162// in-between that cannot be represented as a double.
163constexpr double kMaxDoubleRepresentableInt64 = 9223372036854774784.0;
164constexpr double kMinDoubleRepresentableInt64 =
165 std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min();
166constexpr double kMaxDoubleRepresentableUint64 = 18446744073709549568.0;
167
168// There is no (currently) available constexpr version of base::bit_cast, so
169// we have to make do with constructing the -0.0 bits manually (by setting the
170// sign bit to 1 and everything else to 0).
171// TODO(leszeks): Revisit when upgrading to C++20.
172constexpr int32_t kMinusZeroLoBits = static_cast<int32_t>(0);
173constexpr int32_t kMinusZeroHiBits = static_cast<int32_t>(1) << 31;
174constexpr int64_t kMinusZeroBits =
175 (static_cast<uint64_t>(kMinusZeroHiBits) << 32) | kMinusZeroLoBits;
176
